title: Israelgogo
author: Israelgogo
content: Many of us tends to blame the leaders and everyone around us for how cruel the world is ,we put the blame on others anf fail to realise and see fault that comes from us and how we contribute to the menace, it is easy to point finger and yet we fail to see our own wrong doings,how have you helped others in your own community, your family ,your friend's, how do you treat people,do you take every small opportunity that comes to you to extract money from people.what is your little contribution to people around you, what can they say about you ,will it be positive or negative, do you care to see people succesful around you.Tho the world is cruel ,what are you doing to make it a better place,are you making people around you comfortable or you making them uncomfortable

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Naturally everyone tends to take care of themselves first before looking out others and make their lives better. Nowadays the survival becomes harder so they have no time to care for others than their family members probably in future the condition will become worse and we may only save us from hurdles of life. However we didn't make the life of others we should not make the life of others worse in that sense I don't make anyone's life worse which itself is missing in this profit making world.

comments.author: Mometaskers
comments.body: It is very easy to blame other and not take responsibility for our actions. It is also very easy to just want them to change for the better. But the thing is the only person we can really change is ourselves. As for blaming authorities I think it's fair game since they are supposed to do a job. If I own a restaurant and I'm not getting enough customers than maybe I have myself to blame and need to make changes. If however I was doing fine and then now not getting customers coz the road leading to my spot is being dismantled and and is delayed for more than a month, then I think it's right for me to blame them for my loss. Sure I can't do anything about the road and can only change what I can (focus on deliveries rather than dine-in), I could be forgiven for being pissed off.

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: A leader is another person... one who puts his pants on the same way you do. The difference is that he thinks he knows how to handle your property better than you do. If you agree with him, fine. If you don't agree, get him where it hurts... he is just another person like you.

comments.author: lumbanrang
comments.body: I agree with you. To change the world, you have to start with yourself and then those closest to you. If the people closest to you are not good, how can you change the world for the better.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: For me I take care of my family first and then the society in which I live, personally I try to help people as much as possible with the money I have, reforming society starts from reforming the person himself first, if everyone tries to make himself good we will definitely get a good society, unfortunately some people see The mistakes of others and they ask them to fix themselves, but they never see their mistakes and this is one of the biggest diseases in society because they do nothing but blame people and do nothing useful to society.

comments.author: CrypToMasEE
comments.body: I completely agree with the author, we ourselves are to blame for what is happening in the world now

comments.author: Proro
comments.body: If we really want to change the world, then we should start charging the man standing in the mirror, because if we don't change our mind set and change way we look at our society then we just go on blaming people for the rest of our lives.It time to take action not blaming people, start by acting and you see change coming in to the society.

comments.author: rossjamie
comments.body: I agree with OP. Complaining almost everything is not the answer, you just making the world worse than before, the key to getting a better place in this world is be grateful, even on a global scale financial crash

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: Making the world a better place starts with youActually, it starts with freedom to spread the truth. And not the truth of somebody's platform or ideals. The truth of what's going on in the world. We all know what to do when we find out the truth, and most of us start taking action.

comments.author: Spontaneous
comments.body: Yes, it's true this topic got a point  since a people are not made a perfect things but when you are educated yourself and you have a good behavior you will be able to find and help the world makes better. We all know world are full of influence maybe bad or good . The changes can start ourselves that we can fulfill our world.

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: Making the world a better place starts with youNo, it starts with you. I'm too busy enjoying my wealth.

comments.author: Sayeds56
comments.body: Quote from: Proro on May 19, 2022, 02:50:09 PMIf we really want to change the world, then we should start charging the man standing in the mirror, because if we don't change our mind set and change way we look at our society then we just go on blaming people for the rest of our lives.It time to take action not blaming people, start by acting and you see change coming in to the society.Well said. The process of change starts when we make our selves better human being who is kind, cooperative, compassionate and helps those who really need support to make their lives better. The world is passing through very difficult times due to regional conflicts, wars and COVID-19 pandemic which has created economic crisis world wide, we need to raise our voice and press upon our Political leaderships to do something to address these issues to reduce  the difficulties people are facing to survive.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: So truly said OP, change begins with you and I. What we do ourselves affects the public and the nation as a whole. We first need to change our mentality and how we react and response to certain circumstances because whatever we do has adverse effect on the whole world starting from our home nation. If we can all have a positive mindset to all happenings that affect our life and look for solutions to it, it will be better. As to what we do or say have its effect on the leaders ruling us. The world will be a better place if we all are positively minded in all affairs.

comments.author: Masplanc
comments.body: We all have responsibility to carry out not just our leader. Only the leaders can't make a better society, everybody have a role to play if will wait for the leader to fix up things first and the common citizens are not ready change the society can't be better.  Change starts with every individual not from a particular set of people.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: I totally agree with you on that. For anybody to succeed at this task, you need to have a positive mindset, try to ensure you are not living pretentiously and being judgemental all the time, be a solution bringer too. It is also important to follow peace with as many as we come in contact with and try to be law abiding even when the people we find ourselves around are not. Because most times, if you want change, you have to be the change you seek.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Well, I agree but in reality do you think how difficult is that to practice?Imagine yourself as an honest employee of your company so you do everything perfect but you will be ignored all the time because someone is using the shortcuts to get all of them.Imagine you want to be honest while standing in the queue due to social distancing, people just come and join infront of you? You will still be that good or choose to live how others are living?

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: we all have a part to play in how we treat those close to us. but with that said, we are restricted by the laws of the land we lay our head on.in many restricted countries. just trying to get a passport is not as easy as signing a form and posting it off with a photo. so in those countries where it tougher, they cannot just escape and move to another country. EG England has been more welcoming to Ukrainians with passports compared to syrians without passports. even when both countries had to leave due to war.its not about apathy, empathy or sympathy. its about politics.england will turn away undocumented immigrants even if their lives are at risk on the open sea between calais/dover.. yet those with a passport get a train/flight into england funded by UK government. I as a british person can go to america without even a second look and just stay..but a mexican without a passport cant just get on a plane the way i can. and cannot just walk around like a tourist, freely.

comments.author: CryptocurencyKing
comments.body: The world has never belonged to one man, its collectively owned and ought to be collectively taken care of off. Most times, we see the bad around us, the evil been done in our environment and somehow we entertain fears while waiting on others to summon courage and fight the operation or solve the rising problems. We tend to forget how mortal we all are and that the other party might be needing motivation  too.Not trying to solve a problem is you constituting a problem. We ought to do the most we can, little by littling knowing that when sumed up, it could result in some huge change.Let's try being the force for a Domino Effect!
